title: Bug 18934: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
OB:
Build F2 (20020602)Redhat 7.2, GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only)
When opening the ImageAnalyzer example, I noticed that the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved around. However, they do not have any effect. If I open a small image, such as an icon, the scrollbars are just misleading because they do not do anything.
EB: In the ImageAnalyzer example, the scrollbars should be disabled when opening a small image, like an icon, as they do not have any effect.
SR:
1. Build F2 (20020602)Redhat 7.2, GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only)
2. Open the ImageAnalyzer example.
3. Notice that the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved around.
4. Open a small image, such as an icon.
5. Verify that the scrollbars are disabled as they do not have any effect.
